definition: slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to lose/to miss/to fail
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Once, as it happened, the Professor forgot himself so far as to mention accessible things.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，教授偶然失口，說出一件容易得到的東西。

sentences.english: He sometimes slips into rather dreadful puns and hackneyed language.
sentences.chinese: 他有時會失口說出很刺耳的雙關語和極陳腐的話來。

sentences.english: He babbled out our plans to them.
sentences.chinese: 他失口把我們的計劃泄露給他們了。

definition: slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to blurt out/to let slip
to have loose lips
to blurt out
to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to wake up to reality/to come to oneself/to realize/to see the truth
to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
to regret/to repent
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
anxious
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
(of speech) indistinct/mumbling/hesitating
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly

to resist/to deal with
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
a disgrace/ashamed
